Material used.Description: PET scans were performed on a patient with the p.E64D mutation and his unaffected siblings.

Readout description.Result Description: Reduced dopamine transporter binding in the striatum was observed in the patient compared to unaffected siblings.

Biological replicates.Description: PET scans were performed on three biological replicates (the patient and two unaffected siblings).

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Descriptive statistics were used to compare results.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal dopamine transporter binding levels in PET scans.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly reduced dopamine transporter binding compared to unaffected individuals.

Approved assay.Description: PET is a standard method for assessing dopamine transporter function in Parkinson's disease research.

Material used.Description: Wild-type and mutant DJ1 proteins were purified for structural analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: The p.E64D mutation caused a structural change in the DJ1 protein, leading to altered conformation compared to wild-type.

Technical replicates.Description: Multiple technical replicates were performed for structural analysis.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ1 protein was used as a positive control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein structure consistent with known wild-type DJ1 protein.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Structural deviations from wild-type DJ1 protein.

Approved assay.Description: X-ray crystallography is a standard method for studying protein structures in basic research.

Material used.Description: HEK293 and COS7 cells were transfected with wild-type or mutant DJ1 cDNA.

Readout description.Result Description: The p.E64D mutation led to altered subcellular localization of the DJ1 protein compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each cell type.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated three times for technical consistency.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ1 protein expression was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Descriptive statistics were used for analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein localization patterns consistent with wild-type DJ1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Deviation from normal protein localization patterns.

Approved assay.Description: Immunocytochemistry is a standard method for studying protein expression and localization.
